Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic

Class Precondition

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic.Comparison
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic.Precondition
All Implemented Interfaces:
Atom, Expression, Logical, Proposition, Simplifiable, Typed, Serializable, Comparable<Logical>
public class Precondition extends Comparison implements Atom
A precondition is an atomic comparison which must have one of two formats: a variable on the left and a parameter on the right, or a fluent on the left and a valued expression on the right.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware
See Also:

    • toPrecondition

      public Disjunction<Clause<Precondition>> toPrecondition()
      Description copied from interface: Expression
      Converts an expression whose type is boolean to disjunctive normal form (DNF) suitable to appear in the precondition of an event. A DNF expression is a disjunction of conjunctive clauses whose atoms are preconditions.
      Specified by:
      toPrecondition in interface Expression
      Overrides:
      toPrecondition in class Comparison
      Returns:
      a disjunction of conjunctive clauses whose atoms are preconditions

    • combine

      public Precondition combine(Atom other)
      Description copied from interface: Atom
      If a conjunction of this atom and a given atom can be simplified to a single atom, this method returns that atom; if not, null is returned. If this method returns null, it does not mean the atoms are contradictory (see Atom.negates(Atom)), only that they cannot be combined into a single atom.
      Specified by:
      combine in interface Atom
      Parameters:
      other - the other atom which can possibly be combined with this one
      Returns:
      a single atom which expresses both this atom and the given atom, or null if no such atom exists

    • negates

      public boolean negates(Atom other)
      Description copied from interface: Atom
      Tests whether a conjunction of this atom and a given atom would be a contradiction.
      Specified by:
      negates in interface Atom
      Parameters:
      other - the other atom which might contradict this one
      Returns:
      true if the atoms contradict one another, false otherwise
